data.1: I CALL TO WITNESS the Day of Resurrection,
data.2: And I call the reprehensive soul to witness:
data.3: Does man think We shall not put his bones together?
data.4: Surely We are able to reform even his finger-tips.
data.5: Yet man is sceptical of what is right before him.
data.6: He asks: "When will the Day of Resurrection be?"
data.7: Yet when the eyes are dazzled,
data.9: And the sun and moon are conjoined,
data.10: That day man will say: "Where can I find escape?"
data.11: Never so, for there will be no escape.
data.12: With your Lord alone will be the retreat on that day.
data.13: Then man will be told what he had sent ahead (of good) and what he had left behind.
data.14: In fact man is a witness against himself,
data.15: Whatever the excuses he may offer.
data.16: Do not forestall (the revelation before its completion) by acting in haste.
data.17: Surely its collection and recitation are Our responsibility.
data.18: So, as We recite it, follow its reading.
data.19: The exposition of its meaning surely rests on Us.
data.20: But no. You love this transient life,
data.22: How many faces will be refulgent on that Day,
data.24: And how many faces on that Day will be woe-begone
data.25: Fearing that a great disaster is going to befall them.
data.26: Never so, for when life withdraws into the clavicula,
data.27: And it is asked: "Is there any reciter of charms and amulets?"
data.28: He will then realise it is the parting,
data.29: And anguish will be heaped upon anguish:
data.30: To your Lord then will be the driving.
data.31: For he neither believed nor prayed,
data.32: But only disavowed and turned away;
data.33: Then he strutted back to his people.
data.34: Alas the woe for you, alas!
data.36: Does man think that he will be left alone to himself, free?
data.37: Was he not an emitted drop of semen,
data.38: Then formed into an embryo? Then He fashioned, shaped and proportioned
data.39: And assigned it sexes, male and female.
data.40: Cannot such as He bring the dead to life?
